view

Interface IView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BuyAmountView, BuyPercentageView, BuyView, CreateFixedView, CreatePercentageView, CreateView, DetermineCostView, DetermineFeeView, DetermineValueView, GetAllStateView, GetStateView, JFrameView, LoadPercentageView, LoadPortfolioView, SavePercentageView, SavePortfolioView

    public interface IView
    The interface for our view class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
      this is to force the view to have a method to set up actions for buttons.
      void addKeyListener(java.awt.event.KeyListener listener)
      this is to force the view to have a method to set up the keyboard.
      void clearInputString()
      Clear the text field.
      java.lang.String getInputString()
      Get the string from the text field and return it
      void resetFocus()
      Reset the focus on the appropriate part of the view that has the keyboard listener attached to it, so that keyboard events will still flow through.
      void setEchoOutput(java.lang.String s)
      Set the label that is showing what the model stores.
      void toggleColor()
      Toggle the color of the displayed text.

    • Method Detail

      • setEchoOutput

        void setEchoOutput(java.lang.String s)
        Set the label that is showing what the model stores.

      • getInputString

        java.lang.String getInputString()
        Get the string from the text field and return it

      • clearInputString

        void clearInputString()
        Clear the text field. Note that a more general "setInputString" would work for this purpose but would be incorrect. This is because the text field is not set programmatically in general but input by the user.

      • resetFocus

        void resetFocus()
        Reset the focus on the appropriate part of the view that has the keyboard listener attached to it, so that keyboard events will still flow through.

      • toggleColor

        void toggleColor()
        Toggle the color of the displayed text. This is an explicit view operation because this is something that only the view can control

      • addKeyListener

        void addKeyListener(java.awt.event.KeyListener listener)
        this is to force the view to have a method to set up the keyboard. The name has been chosen deliberately. This is the same method signature to add a key listener in Java Swing. Thus our Swing-based implementation of this interface will already have such a method.

      • addActionListener

        void addActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
        this is to force the view to have a method to set up actions for buttons. All the buttons must be given this action listener Thus our Swing-based implementation of this interface will already have such a method.
